Hello Kyle,

The references you found are pretty old. I would start by subc=
lassing
https://github.com/internetarchive/heritrix3/blob/master/modules/sr=
c/main/java/org/archive/modules/writer/WARCWriterProcessor.java.
Something =
like this might work:

public class CMISWARCWriterProcessor extends WARCWri=
terProcessor {
    protected void setupPool(final AtomicInteger serialNo) {=

        setPool(new CMISWARCWriterPool(serialNo, this,
getPoolMaxActive(),=
 getMaxWaitForIdleMs()));
    }
}

public class CMISWARCWriterPool extends =
WARCWriterPool {
    protected WriterPoolMember makeWriter() {
       retur=
n new CMISWARCWriter(serialNo, (WARCWriterPoolSettings)settings);
    }
}

=
And then write CMISWARCWriter subclassing WARCWriter, and have it
write to =
your CMIS instead of files on disk. (It might turn out some
other way of or=
ganizing the code makes more sense. If so that'll
probably become evident a=
s you're working on it.)

Noah



On Thu, Feb 25, 2016 at 9:23 AM, kyle ada=
ms adamskf@...
[archive-crawler] <archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com> wr=
ote:
>
>
> I'd like to extend Heritrix to write WARCs to another destinatio=
n other than
> to disk. Specifically, I would like to create a processor th=
at writes to a
> CMIS
> (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Content_Management_I=
nteroperability_Services)
> compliant content repository.
>
> I found the f=
ollowing developer docs, but is specific to extraction and not
> writing to=
 a target destination:
> http://crawler.archive.org/articles/developer_manu=
al/processor.html
>
> I also found an HDFS example on GitHub:
> https://git=
hub.com/openplaces/heritrix-hdfs-writer
>
> I'm pretty much a newb, but loo=
king for the group to point me in the right
> direction and validate that I=
'm looking at the right resources.
>
> Thanks,
> Kyle
>
>
>
